guidance: Discard. TED translates at form-level. OCDS translates at field-level.

[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'buyer' to its `.roles`\n\nSet `buyer.id` to its `.id`, and set `buyer.name` to its [`.name`](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/OFFICIALNAME)
Map to the party's `.identifier.id`, and set `.identifier.scheme`

Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to the party's `.address.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)

Take the country code in the `VALUE` attribute, translate to a country name, and map to the party's `.address.countryName`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#524](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/524)) to add a `.countryCode` field to the `Address` object, to avoid translation. (ISSUE)
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), add 'buyer' to its `.roles`, and set its [fields as above](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/OFFICIALNAME)

Discard. If there are multiple parties with the role 'buyer', then the contract involves joint procurement. (When *The contract involves joint procurement* is checked, at least one additional contracting authority is provided.)
Add 'centralPurchasingBody' to the `.roles` of the party (PROPOSAL #11)

Discard. If no `ParticipationFee` object in the `tender.participationFees` array has a `.type` of 'document', then access is unrestricted.\n\nTo provide direct access to procurement documents, add `Document` objects to the `tender.documents` array, and set their `.id` and other fields.

Add a `ParticipationFee` object to the `tender.participationFees` array, set its `.type` to 'document', and set its `.id`.\n\nTo provide details of restrictions, see the [Participation Fees](https://github.com/open-contracting/ocds_participationFee_extension) extension.
Discard. Additional information can be obtained from the abovementioned address unless otherwised specified.

If only the contact person is different, use the [Additional Contact Points](https://github.com/open-contracting/ocds_additionalContactPoints_extension) extension, get the `Organization` object for the buyer, add a `ContactPoint` object to its `.additionalContactPoints` array, and set its [fields as above](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/CONTACT_POINT).\n\nOtherwise, [add a party](../operations#add-a-party), add 'processContactPoint' to its `.roles`, and set its [fields as above](#/CONTRACTING_BODY/ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY/OFFICIALNAME). (PROPOSAL #9)
Add 'electronicSubmission' to `tender.submissionMethod`, and map to `tender.submissionMethodDetails`\n\nIf *to the following address* is selected, this results in a loss of structure. (WARNING #27)
Add 'written' to `tender.submissionMethod`, and discard. Tenders or requests to participate must be submitted to the abovementioned address unless otherwised specified.
Add 'written' to `tender.submissionMethod`, and map to `tender.submissionMethodDetails`\n\nIf *electronically via* is checked, this results in a loss of structure. (WARNING #27)

Get the `Organization` object for the buyer, and add a `Classification` object to its `.details.classifications` array. Set the classification's `.scheme` to 'TED_CA_TYPE', and set its `.id` and/or `.name` as follows: (PROPOSAL #10)

Get the `Organization` object for the buyer, and add a `Classification` object to its `.details.classifications` array. Set the classification's `.scheme` to ['COFOG'](https://unstats.un.org/unsd/publications/catalogue?selectID=145), and set its `.id` and `.name` as follows: (PROPOSAL #10)
Set `tender.classification.scheme` to 'CPV', take the CPV code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to `tender.classification.id` (PROPOSAL #15)

For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the `tender.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to its `.id` (PROPOSAL #16)
Discard. If `tender.lots` is set, then the contract is divided into lots.
Discard. If `tender.lots` isn't set, then the contract isn't divided into lots.
Set `tender.lotDetails.maximumLotsBidPerSupplier` to 1e9999 (which parses to infinity i.e. "all")
Map to `tender.lotDetails.awardCriteriaDetails`\n\nTo provide groups of lots, use `tender.lotGroups`
Discard. This is derived from the values of awards.

comment: This element sets the currency for its children.

guidance: Add an `Item` object to the `tender.items` array, and, if the contract is divided into lots, add a `Lot` object to the `tender.lots` array. If this notice is a call for competition, set the lot's `.status` to 'active'; otherwise, set it to 'planned'.
Map to the item's `.title`, and, if the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.title` (PROPOSAL #29)
If the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.id` and to the item's `.relatedLot`; otherwise, this should be empty.
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPV', and map to its `.id`.
For each `CODE` attribute, add a `Classification` object to the item's `.additionalClassifications` array, set its `.scheme` to 'CPVS', prefix by the *Main CPV code*, and map to its `.id`.

Take the NUTS code in the `CODE` attribute, and map to the item's `.deliveryAddress.region`\n\nThere's an open issue ([#739](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/739)) about region codes. (ISSUE)
Map to the item's `.description`, and, if the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.description`
If the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.value.amount`; otherwise, this should match [II.1.5](#II.1.5).
If the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.value.currency`; otherwise, this should match [II.1.5](#II.1.5).
If the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.contractPeriod.startDate`; otherwise, map to `tender.contractPeriod.startDate` (PROPOSAL #19)
If the contract is divided into lots, map to the lot's `.contractPeriod.endDate`; otherwise, map to `tender.contractPeriod.endDate` (PROPOSAL #19)

Get the `Organization` object for the European Union; if none exists yet, [add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and set its `.name` to 'European Union'. Then, add 'funder' to its `.roles`.\n\nGet the `Finance` object for this project; if none exists yet, add a `Finance` object to the `planning.budget.finance` array, map to its `.description`, set its `.id`, set its `.financingParty.name` to 'European Union', and set its `.financingParty.id` to the party's `.id`. Then, if the contract is divided into lots, add the lot's `.id` to its `.relatedLots`. (PROPOSAL #20)
Discard. If there's no party with the role 'funder' and the name 'European Union', then the procurement isn't related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds.
Append to the item's `.description`\n\nThis results in a loss of structure. (WARNING #28)

The standard forms express exclusion grounds and selection criteria in this section as unstructured text. In the [introductory note](https://github.com/eForms/eForms/raw/master/20180604_eForms_consultation_introduction.docx) to its [eForms consultation](https://github.com/eForms/eForms), the European Commission proposes to create an extension to eForms to implement the [European Single Procurement Document (ESPD)](http://ec.europa.eu/growth/single-market/public-procurement/e-procurement/espd/), which expresses this information as structured data, following the model of the [Core Criterion and Core Evidence Vocabulary](https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/core-criterion-and-core-evidence-vocabulary). With respect to OCDS, work on this section is postponed until either the extension to eForms is available or until the [ESPD Exchange Data Model](https://github.com/ESPD/ESPD-EDM) is stable.
Map to the date component of `tender.tenderPeriod.endDate`
Map to the time component of `tender.tenderPeriod.endDate`
Add an `Award` object to the `awards` array
Set the award's `.statusDetails` to 'unsuccessful'\n\nThere's an open issue ([#764](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues/764)) about status details. (ISSUE)

Set the award's `.status` to 'active'\n\nAdd a `Contract` object to the `contracts` array, set its `.id` and `.awardID` to the award's `.id`, set its `.title` to the award's `.title`, and set its `.status` to 'active'.
Add a `BidsStatistic` object to the `bids.statistics` array, set its `.measure` to 'bids', set its `.id`, and map to its `.value`. Set its `.relatedLot` if the award is related to a lot.
Add a `BidsStatistic` object to the `bids.statistics` array, set its `.measure` to 'smeBids', set its `.id`, and map to its `.value`. Set its `.relatedLot` if the award is related to a lot.
Add a `BidsStatistic` object to the `bids.statistics` array, set its `.measure` to 'foreignBidsFromEU', set its `.id`, and map to its `.value`. Set its `.relatedLot` if the award is related to a lot.

Add a `BidsStatistic` object to the `bids.statistics` array, set its `.measure` to 'foreignBidsFromNonEU', set its `.id`, and map to its `.value`. Set its `.relatedLot` if the award is related to a lot.\n\nThere's an [open issue](https://github.com/open-contracting/ocds-extensions/issues/69) about this code. (ISSUE)
Add a `BidsStatistic` object to the `bids.statistics` array, set its `.measure` to 'electronicBids', set its `.id`, and map to its `.value`. Set its `.relatedLot` if the award is related to a lot.

comment: This element contains elements from V.2.2 and V.2.3.

guidance: Discard. If there are multiple suppliers, then the contract has been awarded to a group of economic operators.

[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'supplier' to its `.roles`\n\nAdd an `OrganizationReference` object to the award's `.suppliers` array, set its `.id` to the party's `.id`, and set its `.name` to the party's [`.name`](#/AWARD_CONTRACT/AWARDED_CONTRACT/CONTRACTORS/CONTRACTOR/ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR/OFFICIALNAME)
For the *Initial estimated total value of the contract/lot*

comment: This element sets the currency for its children.

guidance: [Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'reviewBody' to its `.roles`
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'mediationBody' to its `.roles` (PROPOSAL #4)
[Add a party](../operations#add-a-party), and add 'reviewContactPoint' to its `.roles` (PROPOSAL #25)

For each of the following, add a `Classification` object to the `tender.procurementMethodRationaleCodes` array. Set the classification's `.scheme` to `TED_PT_AWARD_CONTRACT_WITHOUT_CALL`, and set its `.id` and `.name` as follows (PROPOSAL #30)
Set `.id` to 'D_PROC_OPEN' and `.name` to 'No tenders or no suitable tenders/requests to participate in response to open procedure'
Set `.id` to 'D_PROC_RESTRICTED' and `.name` to 'No tenders or no suitable tenders/requests to participate in response to restricted procedure'
Set `.id` to 'D_TECHNICAL' and `.name` to 'The works, supplies or services can be provided only by a particular economic operator due to absence of competition for technical reasons'

Set `.id` to 'D_ARTISTIC' and `.name` to 'The works, supplies or services can be provided only by a particular economic operator due to procurement aiming at the creation or acquisition of a unique work of art or artistic performance'

Set `.id` to 'D_PROTECT_RIGHTS' and `.name` to 'The works, supplies or services can be provided only by a particular economic operator due to protection of exclusive rights, including intellectual property rights'

Set `.id` to 'D_EXTREME_URGENCY' and `.name` to 'Extreme urgency brought about by events unforeseeable for the contracting authority and in accordance with the strict conditions stated in the directive'

Set `.id` to 'D_REPETITION_EXISTING' and `.name` to 'New works/services, constituting a repetition of existing works/services and ordered in accordance with the strict conditions stated in the directive'
Set `.id` to 'D_FROM_WINDING_PROVIDER' and `.name` to 'Purchase of supplies or services on particularly advantageous terms from a supplier which is definitively winding up its business activities'

Set `.id` to 'D_FROM_LIQUIDATOR_CREDITOR' and `.name` to 'Purchase of supplies or services on particularly advantageous terms from the liquidator in an insolvency procedure, an arrangement with creditors or a similar procedure under national laws and regulations'
Set `.id` to 'D_OUTSIDE_SCOPE' and `.name` to 'The procurement falls outside the scope of application of the directive'
